website_summaries.verdict: An entry-level steam inhaler designed for relief from occasional respiratory distress.
pros: Cool tap water may be used
Provides up to 15 minutes of steam therapy
cons: Does not accept essential oils or saline solution
Water gets extremely hot and may slosh a bit

customer_reviews.title: Completely useless!
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother with this! It has little steam you don't even feel the steam. It's WAY OVER PRICED for something SO CHEAPLY MADE. I would only spend less than $15 max for this!
customer_reviews.author: g3heavenlyfruit

customer_reviews.title: Does not work well, the design is awkward and ...
customer_reviews.text: Does not work well, the design is awkward and uncomfortable. To get any steam, you have to put your face close to the plastic, and that burns sometimes. But if the face if far away, you get nothing, almost no benefit.
customer_reviews.author: E.V.

customer_reviews.title: Now the entire product is useless. What can I do now
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in December 2017. In February 2018, its one main plastic piece is broken. Now the entire product is useless. What can I do now ? I don’t think I can return it now. Will Vick’s replace the piece. The product can not be used anymore. Plastic quality is not great. Hope Vick’s respond to this and provide me a solution. I have no other complaints about functioning of the product. But quality of materials could have been better.
customer_reviews.author: Lishar

customer_reviews.title: Better than nothing - It makes steam, but has some real flaws!
customer_reviews.text: This product makes steam, yes. But it makes little of it, compared to the last steam inhaler I had, and it also has these issues: 1. Steam leaks out around the ill fitting face piece, which is a one size fits all thing. 2. Face piece actually has a good sized opening in it that lets steam OUT, which defeats the purposes of getting a lot of steam to breathe in! 3. Pieces that come off to add water are not the easiest to put back where they belong. Just not very "user friendly" in my opinion. I won't send it back, but am going shopping again for what I had before.
customer_reviews.author: circawdm

customer_reviews.title: THEE BEST!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Had this thing since 2008, and still using it! You can't beat it with a ten-foot pole. Get yours today before they stop making these!!!!! After 8 years, this thing is dubbed a WORK HORSE!!! Great for singers and speakers, use before and after your gig or engagement. You don't need to add any oils, just regular plain ole water!!!
customer_reviews.author: Minstrel Prophet

customer_reviews.title: Needs auto shutoff
customer_reviews.text: I like the product. However there is a safety issue that should be fixed. It won’t shutoff when it’s out of water which can be a fire hazard. On more than one occasion I walked away from it while it was heating up only to forget about it. FYI
customer_reviews.author: Seahunters

customer_reviews.title: ... wish I could give it more stars because I love all things Vicks
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give it more stars because I love all things Vicks, but even after following instructions and having the steam vent closed off as much as possible, the steam is so hot that it gives my chin and face a burning sensation because it's so hot. You can't return this item because it's medical (or some variation of that reason, the Amazon CS rep couldn't pinpoint). My return has ended amicably, but don't buy this if you don't want to burn your face.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Terrific for Vocalists
customer_reviews.text: I love this. I purchased it after reading many articles that recommended it for vocalists. I sing in a local rock band a couple times a week, and talk a lot at my day job. I've begun using the steam inhaler prior to every gig, and have found that it has helped sooth and restore my throat/voice (in addition to gargling warm salt water). I've been singing in bands for 20 years, and wish I had found this sooner. Even through allergy season, this was a huge help. It's super easy to use and to clean. I've been recommending it to others who I've heard talk about tired or worn out voice (or sinus issues affecting their voice).
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Soothing relief
customer_reviews.text: What a nifty little appliance. It's helping soothe and clear the congestion in my airways......from the flu. So relaxing. Soothing relief from coughing and congestion from the flu. In reading up on steam inhalers it's nice to know they help with opening pores on your face, too. It's doing double duty. Read about adding essential oils, fresh herbs, or green tea to water......a lovely facial.....and doing this at night just before bedtime is a great way to relax and be ready for sleep. I can see myself using this after the flu is gone. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The steam was hot and difficult to stay in stream ...
customer_reviews.text: The steam was hot and difficult to stay in stream more than 30 seconds to a minute. This short time wasn't enough to benefit the need for moisture.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for cold and dry winter days.
customer_reviews.text: Not quit a steam room but works well. Steam gets pretty hot so be careful. Item helps to loosen up blockage in sinus passages, helping with congestion. Buy the Kaz pads as they work better with this than Vicks' own pads. Soothes on cold and dry winter days, really helps.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it !! Good Product.
customer_reviews.text: Read so many mixed reviews and was initially skeptical on how this product would finally be. Ended up ordering it anyways as this is a trusted brand. Received the product in pristine condition, no issue with packaging either. Easy to assemble. Instructions are straight forward. Have been using this for almost a month now and it works fine. Does the job, value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Nav

customer_reviews.title: Easily burned!
customer_reviews.text: Whoever designed this product needs help! My wife was burned 2nd degree and needed surgery as a result! Why? The vent control and face mask is very hard to turn and adjust. The water is bubbling boiling and has no depth in the chamber. Spills easily!
customer_reviews.author: GringoBob

customer_reviews.title: Love it so much, I use it on a regular basis!
customer_reviews.text: I am a vocalist in artist development and have random bouts of allergies and nasal drainage that require medications that dry out my vocal cords and lead to hoarseness..... this product was recommended to me to help keep them extra hydrated (along with extra water intake) and it helps me throat and voice feel amazing! I use it on a regularly basis now, before longer practices/recording/performing and it just really helps keep my airways open and that extra bit of hydration for best sound quality. Highly recommend for those suffering from allergies and drying out issues!
customer_reviews.author: PS

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous!
customer_reviews.text: CAUTION! This item is extremely hot. It burned my face once and my hand twice. This is definitely not the choice for homes with children. Also be aware that it is nonrefundable. I didn't realize this and I had a struggle to get refunded. Normally, I wouldn't fight my oversight but this is a defective dangerous product. I'm very unhappy. Take my advise and find a safer product. --- Shame on you Vicks for not caring about a burned loyal customer. Decades of buying your products down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: BabsBuys

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product!
customer_reviews.text: I have had sinus issues since 5 years and nothing seemed to work for me. A friend recommended this product. I bought it and began using and this has worked wonders for me. About 20 minutes of using this everyday for about 2 weeks helped me so much! Now, even if I don't have sinus or cold issues, I still use it once a week. 1) It's a great practise for the skin 2) It's always beneficial to remove the toxins from your respiratory tract
customer_reviews.author: Nidhi

customer_reviews.title: $$$ vaporized
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think that this company would sell such a poor quality product and to add insult to injury price is expensive. I thought this product was comparable is effectiveness to The Purmist, which I do have. I only bought this product because of the menthol option. What a waste of money. I don't even get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Misha

customer_reviews.title: Essential for Touring Singers.
customer_reviews.text: I used this everyday on our last tour. Essential for touring singers staying in crappy hotel rooms. Put a couple of drops of your favorite essential oils in there with water and fire it up. My only issue with this was the length of the mask area... if they made it a little bit longer it wouldn't burn your face off.
customer_reviews.author: David Reed Watson

customer_reviews.title: Used During Covid and Really Helps My Quick Recovery
customer_reviews.text: I used this product when I had Covid. I used this from day until I recovered from Covid within 2 1/2 weeks. I just poured water on it & deep breathe on it for 20mins 3x daily. This really helped my quick recovery (besides gargle warm water salt solution & breathing exercise, vitamins & zinc). Now, I am gladly sharing this item to my friends, co-workers & family, sharing to others what I did and recommending this product to them. I frequently buy 1-2 pcs of this to giveaway as a gift. I highly recommended that each household should have at least one of this , just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We used this to help with chronic sinusitis for both ...
customer_reviews.text: We used this to help with chronic sinusitis for both my husband and myself. It works really well. And I just put fresh essential oil on the pad they provide instead of buying refills.
customer_reviews.author: Shelleyz

customer_reviews.title: Must have for every family
customer_reviews.text: Steam inhalers provide quicker and better relief than ingesting all the acetomenophen, doxylamines and hurting your liver. these OTC ones just suppress the mucus. For better quicker and relief, for kids, I use these steam inhalers with camphor or vicks gel, couple sessions, and third day you feel a lot better. I felt it with my kid and myself.
customer_reviews.author: Ashok Ramkumar

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I opened it the first day just to test it out and see if this thing really works, to my surprise, it REALLY WORKS. I wasn't even sick but after using this inhaler, it really opened up my chest breathing pathway which I didn't even know was congested until using this machine. I bought 2 more of these machines for family members to help fight this pandemic.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Setting it up was easy and simple
customer_reviews.text: Just ordered this this morning and received it today (literally 20 minutes ago). My acute bronchitis comes randomly during this time of year and I figured its about time I bought one of these things. Setting it up was easy and simple. It worked wonders, I can actually feel a difference in my chest. I can breathe a little better and my sinuses cleared up just a little bit (I somehow produce a looooot of mucus). Going to be using this every night before bed!
customer_reviews.author: Richie (Sayeef) Khan

customer_reviews.title: Great little product.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product!. I cannot see how the more expensive similar products with their high prices could be any better than this. Buy it. You'll like it.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt B.

customer_reviews.title: Use with caution, read directions
customer_reviews.text: This is nice, you have to be careful concerning the temperature though, you can get burned if you place your face to close to the heat vents. I declined to use the Vicks pad with it for now, I think that might be too strong. For now, it is helpful with opening sinuses.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mang

customer_reviews.title: A breath of fresh air
customer_reviews.text: I just received my VPSI today and used it immediately. I've been suffering from bronchitis now for over a week and this unit is wonderful for opening up my bronchial tubes and allowing me to cough up that nasty phlegm. This product works like a charm and it's not bulky so you don't have to worry about storage space. Well put together device I'm impressed. I just wanted to let everyone know that the Vapopads have two slots on the white base where you adjust the flow of the steam to lie flat.
customer_reviews.author: JByrne3

customer_reviews.title: Cheap piece of plastic
customer_reviews.text: You will get weird smell along with the steam. It’s a weird plastic smell. The quality of this item is pretty cheap. This product is overpriced. This items definitely don’t deserve such high price. Also it’s not returnable so I had to deal with amazon chat support who helped me get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Compact and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to help me breathe while recovering from pneumonia. It is small enough to take with for travel. And it is very easy to use. It really helped immensely. Note: Be cautious of the steam. Do not put your whole face into the mask. You must keep your face a couple of inches off the mask in order to not burn yourself. Extremely hot!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle C

customer_reviews.text: Smoked to many cigs on a night out on the town? Feel like you’re gonna die of asthma! This is the thing u need while I drink your coconut water to replenish your h2o cells. Throw on a face mask while your at it and book you’ll feel refreshed af. I actually use now weekly cuz it feels so refreshing and to help my Voice with singing cuz ya know I do the thing 🎤
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: Nice steamer
customer_reviews.text: I use mine all the time. The only downside, is first that it is made of plastic, and made in china. The second issue is that if you are not super careful, you can drip hot water on yourself. It is really easy to do if you move the cup, or the top has some condensation. I also wish the plastic mask went on a bit easier. It is easy to install the wrong way if you take it off to clean. I feel it calms the breathing down a bit. I do not use the vicks pads. Just use it plain. Breathing in the vapor. It doesn't last long but it seems helpful while I'm using it.
customer_reviews.author: Serene Night

customer_reviews.title: Not portable and a little awkward to use but it works
customer_reviews.text: Bought this during a time I was extremely sick and couldn’t breathe right, the product works, my only complain is that it’s not very user friendly if you’re not stopped in one place during the whole session, and you have to be extremely careful not to spill the water. I’m definitely getting one that is portable. If that is a problem for you as well, get a portable one.
customer_reviews.author: Lorena

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best gadget I've bought in a while.Cancer took a lung.This keeps me breathing clear.Good job - good product.
customer_reviews.author: Gary P.

customer_reviews.title: But like I said it does the job
customer_reviews.text: Middle piece which holds the oils and controls the amount of steam came broken. ☹️ But I have to say Vicks has to uppen thier game when it comes to these products. They do the job intended but the steam machines don't hold up for very long. I have another steam product the big bulky gallon one and that one is a head ache. But like I said it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy. Produces very little steam
customer_reviews.text: This inhaler producers very little steam. In an attempt to make this producer extremely safe it has rendered it completely useless. Suggest you save your money and just heat a pot of water on the stove. You'll get better results.
customer_reviews.author: Lou Zumek

customer_reviews.title: Works better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help clear up my husbands ongoing congestion that seemed to worsen at night. He was typically fine during the day but would cough all night long and wasn't able to sleep. He started using this just before he went to bed. He was able to loosen much of the congestion prior to going to bed, enabling him to get a better nights rest. Within a week the congestion had disappeared. It worked just as I had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Cornell

customer_reviews.title: works well to heal colds and lung and sinus issues
customer_reviews.text: Wears out after a few dozen uses, but works well to heal colds and lung and sinus issues. I add eucalyptus essential oil to it (just one drop). That may cause the lining to wear out earlier, but eucalyptus is important to use. The mask and collar are removable and can be cleaned between uses. The amount of steam can be adjusted. I keep an extra one of these around just in case I get a lung or sinus infection.
customer_reviews.author: Justa Person

customer_reviews.title: Garbage, Vicks makes Garbage that stops working in a month or two
customer_reviews.text: Dont buy Vicks. Stops working in a month, never gave a good solid stream of steam. Amazon would not return, very disappointed with vickes and Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: defective product
customer_reviews.text: Not recommend after several times of using the product the plastic started to melt and brake
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: this product is excellent, and the quality meets the expected recommendation!
customer_reviews.text: The shopkeeper has a good attitude. I am satisfied with the quick delivery and good attitude! Good, good! Online shopping was too tense. I didn't expect the service in the store to be so good, the goods were of good quality and low price, and the sellers were also very enthusiastic. Next time, I hope to have the opportunity to cooperate next time.
customer_reviews.author: Eila

customer_reviews.title: Good Product, Excellent Price!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little inhaler. It’s light, easy to use, and works well. I haven’t had any problems with the steam temperatures but if you’re concerned about the steam burning your face, keep 3”-4” away from the inhaler and adjust the valve. Let the steam work it’s way gently into your system; more isn’t always better! I used this with colloidal silver and it was perfect. It’s a great price and compact enough to use it anywhere. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Works miracles!!!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and gets the job done. My husband had a sinus infection so we used this and it cleared him all up it’s powerful and strong. If you have any trouble with it look up a tube vide on it but it’s very simple to use it would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Ceecee

customer_reviews.title: natural remedy
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for those stuffy noses. I've been allowing my daughter to use it when she feels like she can't breathe through her nose (due to allergies) and it seems to help her. I don't like using pharmaceuticals unless they are a last resort, so any natural remedy is worth trying. So far, we haven't had any problems with it. This along with nasal rinsing (with kids xylitol nasal spray) has helped her avoid needing to go straight to the zyrtech.
customer_reviews.author: jmich

customer_reviews.title: No Return!. This is no different from putting a pot of water on the stove. Money down the drain.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this item was similar to the PureMist inhaler. I used it as soon as I received it because my allergies and asthma have been horrible. However, when I received it and followed the instructions to use it, I realized that it was no different than the pot of water that I put on the stove. Actually this isn't as good as the post of water because the steam escapes because you can't rest your head on hit. With the pot of water I can put a towel over my head to make sure no steam escapes. I threw money away on this one and it can't be returned.
customer_reviews.author: London Michaels

customer_reviews.title: Hard to believe there are not more made of this type of inhaler
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. My first one was worn out. I had it a few years but it would have lasted longer, but like most things these days it is made of plastic. I HIGHLY recommend ONLY using distilled water in it as even filtered water has some sediment and minerals in it. I use this with my own pads and natural essential oils (no chemicals) for my allergies and chest congestion. I have searched all over and for the price this is the best one I can find. I would have given it 5 stars if it was sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: o2binhvn

customer_reviews.title: No more suffering from sinus problems
customer_reviews.text: Brought it for my Daughter. She's 37 and suffer from sinus problems. She said this item has helped her so much. Even after going to the doctor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This wasn't that great.
customer_reviews.text: It looks cheap and the fact that you can't insert your full face makes this pretty much useless. Also the steam is really hot so you have to stay like couple of inches away if you don't want to get burned. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Niraj Khanal

customer_reviews.title: helps with sore throat
customer_reviews.text: as a singer I often use this at first sign of sore throat so as to keep vocal cords healthy. I, also, recommend it to my patients who use it for allergy symptoms such as stuffy nose and post nasal drip.
customer_reviews.author: Robin S.

customer_reviews.title: Dificult to breath in directly
customer_reviews.text: I was referred to this product by an RN when I was sick. I used it, but it is difficult to breath in directly. It is nice to have the scented steam directly pushed towards us. Will need to use again to give a better review.
customer_reviews.author: Funtime

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not as good as the old Kaz model
customer_reviews.text: I had my old Kaz steam inhaler for almost 20 years, and was still working fine, but I gave it to one of my voice students who needed one and couldn't afford to buy a new one. So I figured it was time for a new one for myself, and after ready reviews of the different models available, got this one. It's fine, but the reservoir is some kind of non-stick surface, harder to clean because of the new design (not because anything sticks to it). Otherwise, this seems to work just fine. I'll check back in 20 years and let you know if it's still working!
customer_reviews.author: Denise Daverso

customer_reviews.title: Feels so good
customer_reviews.text: When I am breathing in the steam vapor, it feels so good. I haven't been congested but imagine it would be wonderful for that too. I've had severe sinus headaches this summer - often for 3 days, a break for a couple of days and then another one. I'm not sure if this is why I'm having less headaches but I will continue because I know the moisture is good for the sinuses. Also, after the Vicks was out of the pad, I put a few drops of Eucalyptus oil on the pad and it works great. Amazon.com always shows other products that people have bought with the steam inhaler. So I ordered that too.
customer_reviews.author: Senior Carol

customer_reviews.title: Ok for price but fairly lightweight plastic and flimsy and ...
customer_reviews.text: Ok for price but fairly lightweight plastic and flimsy and you really need to be careful in using because otherwise hot water burn risk is definitely a possibility
customer_reviews.author: know when to fold em

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy this with the negative reviews but glad I did. Works great! Very soothing! Easy to use. Plenty of steam. And I love the Vick’s strips u can use with it. I have the flu & was tired of bending over the sink with a towel to get steam. I just sit at my breakfast bar and have it on my countertop. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Doreen S

customer_reviews.title: Works well, not sure how safe it is after a while
customer_reviews.text: Its good and serves the purpose, although i have noticed that a sort of white plaque seems to form on the inside where the water would go..this could be lime but I have tried washing it by manafacturers standards (with white vinegar solution) from when i got it and this problem still persists. I'm not too sure how safe it is to be inhaling that stuff but in this poisonous world we live in, i'll take my chances.
customer_reviews.author: Ross O'Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Not too shabby
customer_reviews.text: Good price for this little gem. The steam goes get hotter than I expected, as I underestimated how close you are to the steam source when you get fully into the mask. But comfy. I tried walking around with it. Spillage happened. Rather small reservoir for the water. But it does the trick for a quick treatment.
customer_reviews.author: C. McLamb

customer_reviews.title: Nix that stuffy nose!
customer_reviews.text: An updated version of a steamer I've had for years. A bit more complex to set up but worth the effort especially for those with allergies or stuffy noses.
customer_reviews.author: Jude Cowell

customer_reviews.title: Great For Your Throat
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of audio recordings and was looking for something to help keep my vocal chords moist. A good 20 minutes with this little portable inhaler and I'm good to go. It heats up pretty fast, it's quite light, and the adjustable vents make it easy to use. You do have to pay attention though, it's certainly HOT steam coming out of this sucker, so be very careful to not burn yourself with it. But overall? I can't recommend it enough if you're wanting something small and compact, not too expensive, and gets the job done. This little inhaler is a powerhouse!
customer_reviews.author: Narratrix

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is fantastic. I bought of pack of pads and recharge them with my own oils. My only complaint is that the resevoir should be 3 x bigger.
customer_reviews.author: refuse analyst

customer_reviews.title: I really liked the product until finding that it had cracked after ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly. I really liked the product until finding that it had cracked after having it only a couple of weeks. This leaves me very disappointed with it.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Steam on lowest setting can still be a bit hot for some people
customer_reviews.text: I think I would like this better if the water didn't get quite so hot. I can get used to it, and it works well for clearing the sinus passages, but I wouldn't use it for a child or anyone with facial skin that's sensitive to high heat. Overall, minus 1 star for being too hot, but a good product nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: So far, this product is okay. I like that it provides continuous steam but it is way too hot to keep your face over/on the inhaler hood. I have to hold my nose/mouth about 2 inches from the top of the inhaler hood, otherwise it burns. It also hasn't really relieved my sinus infection. I will continue to use. Maybe I need to do it more often.
customer_reviews.author: Selima117

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR USE WITH KAZ OR VICKS PADS
customer_reviews.text: Manual says NEVER put inhalants or medicines in the water, this steamer has no pockets for them as is only *a Steamer* Wish I knew that before I ordered it. There is a Vicks steamer designed for scent pads and for only a few dollars more, I am pissed and have learned to shop more at Walmart!
customer_reviews.author: SugarCookie

customer_reviews.title: This is the best steamer i have ever had
customer_reviews.text: This is the best steamer i have ever had. I needed to start taking steam with the oncoming allergy season. The plastic top body is soft and not very hard plastic and snugly fits on face, due to which steam inhalation is quite effective. It takes 2-3 minutes for steam to get started but once it starts, i could us it for 10-20 min without water refill. Sometime while layer deposits inside when all the water is used. It can be easily cleaned with a wet tissue.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Waste Of Money
customer_reviews.text: 1/2 a cup of hot water works just as good an costs alot less. Also can not return.
customer_reviews.author: lori  leigh

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied, decent for price
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent product, but be careful to not knock it when its going or you'll have hot water splashing on you. Small, compact and functional. Very HOT steam, so beware.
customer_reviews.author: nonyer bizness

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful When Using It
customer_reviews.text: The friend I bought it for used it today as soon as it arrived. There is a v cut into the bottom of the mask which drips boiling water onto the user's chest if not kept level. The reservoir is so small it only takes a few tablespoons of water and runs out after 4 or 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha Middleton

customer_reviews.title: Great, but hot enough to burn skin
customer_reviews.text: The steam is too hot. You can’t hold this on your face as it is designed to do because you will get burned. However it does pump out a lot of steam, so you can just kind of sit near it or hold it in your lap and it works great. The little cent square that comes with it is very very very strong.
customer_reviews.author: Erica_O

customer_reviews.title: i recommend for singers
customer_reviews.text: I've had this a few weeks & it's very, very helpful. I only wish it was labeled more effectively. If you open it up for too much steam, you'll melt your face off. If you use just a little, you lee be able to comfortably test your chin & nose in the inhaler & get warm- not boiling- steam for 39 minutes or so. Warning label, GAHHH! The medicated pad doesn't fit in very well, & for the price they should give you a few? Nit just one. It's a very nice lubricating inhaler I'd recommend, though
customer_reviews.author: Precious Powder Puff

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Cheap overpriced piece of crap do not buy this go buy a kettle or a Vick’s steamer for half the price it only holds about an oz of water and is so flimsy it Felt like it wouldn’t work more than once
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great.
customer_reviews.text: The design makes using the product inconvenient and uncomfortable. I want the face mold to be longer in order to allow the steam further to travel to the face. The proximity to the boiling water and thus the extremely hot vapor makes breathing it seem unsafe (even after closing the vent).
customer_reviews.author: Britt

customer_reviews.title: It's cumbersome
customer_reviews.text: When you read the description you think this is a pretty straightforward plug-in play Help clear your sinuses device however there's a little more set up to it then the description would lead you to believe it does however work but I can only really give it three and a half Stars
customer_reviews.author: The Dude

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!  Simple, healing, and reliable
customer_reviews.text: We have had a terrible winter of bronchitis, colds, and congestion. This Vicks Personal Steam Inhaler has been a balm. It is so easy to use. Easy to clean. It has brought us so much relief. It was recommended to us by a nurse, and we thank her from our hearts every time we use it!
customer_reviews.author: D. King

customer_reviews.title: good inhaler
customer_reviews.text: This is a good inhaler, I do it every other day and I also bought the vicks vapo liquid that I add it before inhaling it, works very well.
customer_reviews.author: pg

customer_reviews.title: Great for allergies
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I have allergies and sinus issues and this is the bomb! Cleans my airways with steam. I hate the cold humidifiers
customer_reviews.author: natalie creasman

customer_reviews.title: Check it ou good upon opening. If the mask is not perfect return it.
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised, but must have been boxed shortly after being molded. The rubberized mask portion is folded over on one side and rubs pretty badly. I thought it would relax over several uses, but it has not.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Browning

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality, and amazing price
customer_reviews.text: I originally was going to get the portable hand held one off of target but it was smaller and it cost $50 So when I searched it on here i found this one for way cheaper and a little bigger, so I went for it and I don’t regret it. I use it before I warm up my voice for singing just to moisten my throat, and it’s been doing me wonders.
customer_reviews.author: Aliah

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: Every winter I get a dry cough that absolutely will not go away with Albuterol or any other treatment. Used 3-4 times per day, this device provides me with almost complete relief within a few days. The real trick is to use it at the first sign of congestion, and not days or weeks after it has set in. The second trick is to continue for a few days after you feel full relief to make sure you knock it down completely and don't have a relapse. I wish they made this in the same size as the V1300 (worthless non-electeric model).
customer_reviews.author: John A. Klein

customer_reviews.title: steam humifier
customer_reviews.text: It is excellent for people who have asthma and allegies. Please send my free gift as soon as possible. Thank you. Ms. Washington.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa L. Washington

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice unit. It only takes a few minutes for the steam to develop. Placing the face near but not on the facial mask is the key. A good treatment lasts 10 minutes or more. Repeated use has helped ease the tension in my lungs during my recent allergy bout. I am glad to have it. Only two parts to assemble and it's ready to use. I will begin to experiment with cotton balls soaked in essential oil soon (one or two drops) to see if that works. They do include a small pad with Vick's on it as a trial. You can buy these pads separately.
customer_reviews.author: elgreco

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: last one broke down after 15 years. glad you offer this. a personal inhaler much better than a public steam bath. think i kept reinfecting myself at the gym. no way to keep those places as clean as they should be. virus thrives in a hot/ moist environment. ear/nose/ throat guy instructed me years ago that steam was the best thing for sinus infections. don't use sprays (rebound effect). this unit can be kept clean and you don't catch other peoples germs.
customer_reviews.author: johnny suede

customer_reviews.title: The steam has a plastic smell
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used this inhaler, there was a noticeable smell of plastic in the steam. Some plastics are carcinogenic, and I don't know what kind this is. I could have tried washing the inhaler with vinegar and water, or perhaps the smell would have worn off on its own. But even if I couldn't detect a smell, I'd still wonder what I was inhaling. I returned the inhaler. I have a porcelain teapot that has a built-in heating coil, and that works pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was hoping for more
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't provide much steam for me, more just like warm air with a bit of moisture. If you really cover every air release point and let it build for a minute, you can get a good inhale... thats a but inconvenient, but thats the only way it works fo rme.
customer_reviews.author: Preston

customer_reviews.title: great little steam vapo
customer_reviews.text: Thinks little steam vaporizer works great when you need quick relief. I think that's what it's good for, quick, quick relief but no staying power if you are very congested. We bought this when we had a bad bout of respiratory flu. There was a point I couldn't smell or taste anything for several days the congestion was so bad. I used this machine several times a day during my illness and gave some temporary relief which I was grateful for. Great to have on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great steam inhaler helped me breathe.
customer_reviews.text: I had a nasty bronchitis. Doctor ordered steam. Hate to sit over a stove with a kettle so ordered this. It worked fine, helped me breathe and it's now put away til next time. An excellent item for home treatment of upper respiratory problems where warm steam would help.
customer_reviews.author: PatD

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: It burns your face right away and does not really give much steam. Wanted to return but I could not. Have to find their return policy. This product was way too much expensive for what it is. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: christiane shertz

customer_reviews.title: NOT A GOOD PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT! Not enough steam even at maximum. How do you expect water that is basically 3 table spoon when boiled will provide enough steam to clear your nasal passages or even reach your lungs. Might as well boil 1 liter of water and put in a pan and cover your face with blanket. Steam is better. This product is badly designed. Again, do no buy. PLUS THEY WONT LET ME RETURN THIS ITEM.
customer_reviews.author: Teresita Cruz

customer_reviews.title: A Little Too Hot
customer_reviews.text: While I ultimately like this inhaler, the steam is too hot. I can't keep my face in the plastic cradle for very long because I feel like the steam is burning my face. The solution? I put a shawl in very my head and create a steam tent. It is still worth having because it is a lot safer than doing the same thing over boiling water on the stove, and the steam really does help soothe coughs and sinus irritation. It just could have been designed better.
customer_reviews.author: S.H.D.

customer_reviews.title: Too hot
customer_reviews.text: Works great, just way too hot to actually rest my face on the soft plastic. Definitely hover your face about an inch above the opening when using this.
customer_reviews.author: Si

customer_reviews.title: Great for singers
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I didn't like about this item is the sample pad that came with it. This inhaler is really great for singers to get moisture to your vocal cords. I use mines without the without the essential oil pads. I love it, its great!
customer_reviews.author: D.Monique

customer_reviews.title: The price is great
customer_reviews.text: Works great easy to use, doesn't take long to heat up, don't have to put face real close to get benefit from the steam. Vapor pads are awesome really open up the sinuses. Wife and I really like it. Its a lot cheaper than the pure mist that sell for about 4x times more.
customer_reviews.author: D. Weeks

customer_reviews.title: Get Vapor.Pads Also
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son who.jas chronic sinus issues. It helps significantly. Be sire to read and follow instructions and biy a box of vapor.pads with it. Only 1 comes in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Joyles

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, good price.
customer_reviews.text: easy to use, even my child with heightened sensory challenges was comfortable using it at his comfort level. He has bad sinus issues so even a little was good for him.
customer_reviews.author: G Byrd

customer_reviews.title: All I had was a hot face
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money to have face melt in the steam. Seems to produce steam that is a little to hot and did not seem to help open any sinus or lungs. Sorry...tried to like, but you are tied to the wall with a short cord looking for a place to lean into. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Papa Ron

customer_reviews.title: Inhaler for MS patient - didn't work as well as planned.
customer_reviews.text: It is a decent product, but didn't work as well as planned for person that has MS.
customer_reviews.author: Partner4Care

customer_reviews.title: Been Using These Since I Was Little.
customer_reviews.text: I just bought another one of these to replace our over 7 year old unit. It was still working but had some cracks that I felt were getting dirty. The quality is still the same, not something that can be said for a lot of products. This isn't a lifesaver but it does help when you are sick and clogged up.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Pro singer gives two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a full-time singer/entertainer, and the Vicks Personal Steam Inhaler has been a huge help in keeping my voice relaxed and healthy. I have two - one for home and one I keep with me on the road. Highly recommended if you do a lot of singing, acting, and public speaking.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Salyer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size, very handy and works great!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect small device, easy to use. It take about 3mins to start the steam and works great!
customer_reviews.author: saurabh shirode

customer_reviews.title: Soothing
customer_reviews.text: A true help with my bronchitis. Soothing steam was a real blessing! So easy to use. Add water and turn on. Within 1 minute you have soothing steam.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't have ask for more
customer_reviews.text: Love the part that: 1. You can control the level of steam. 2. Use it just as steam or use with Vicks. 3. The face or chin rest is perfect fit for adults but kids enjoy to rest their chin as it's very soft. 4. Compact design for easy storage 5. I have come across steam inhalers whose body gets hot after using for a while but this one doesn't have any such problem; very safe.
customer_reviews.author: SKJ

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Love this!! Bought it to kick the never ending cold running through our family this year. I've used it for 3 days and it is the difference between relying on night time cold pills to breathe through my nose or using steam. I choose steam!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon addict

customer_reviews.title: Dual-Voltage!
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered this, I wasn't even focused on the fact that it runs on 110V and 220V current. It was a nice surprise to find out that I could use it abroad without a transformer. (Most consumer durable goods are 110V only.) The steam is very hot, and I found I could use it only on the lowest settings. Also, the fact you have to lower your face onto the unit is a minus. If the clear plastic piece were to be lengthened and molded into a shape that would allow the user to put his face into it while holding his head level, that would be a better design.
customer_reviews.author: AmericanAbroad

product_meta.title: Vicks Personal Steam Inhaler, V1200, Face Steamer or Inhaler with Soft Face Mask for Targeted Steam Relief, Aids with Sinus Problems, Congestion, Cough, Use With Soothing Menthol Vicks VapoPads
product_meta.description:
VICKS STEAM INHALER: Vicks Personal Steam Inhaler, with a soft, comfortable face mask and compatible with soothing menthol Vicks VapoPads, provides a warm mist of steam for temporary relief from allergies, congestion and coughs in a 5-15 minute treatment. Ingredients: Scent Pad: Glycol, Hercolyn D, Menthol Crystals, Camphor, Eucalyptus Oil.

AMAZON.COM
For cold, flu, bronchitis, sinusitis, laryngitis, and allergy sufferers, this personal steam inhaler restores sufficient moisture to the lungs and respiratory tract. The patented plastic hood is contoured to cradle the face comfortably and directs warm moist air right into the nose and throat to temporarily relieve nasal, sinus, and chest congestion. Water goes into the units easy-to-fill base where a patented heater gently boils it. The adjustable control lets you choose the amount of steam that rises up into the hood. A short 5- to 15-minute treatment is all that is required to make nasal and throat passages feel clearer. This small inhaler is compact for easy storage or travel to work or abroad and has dual voltage for use anywhere in the world. For enhanced relief from cold/flu symptoms, this inhaler is compatible with Kaz Aromatic Inhalant Pads, which release soothing menthol and eucalyptus vapors. This steam inhaler is covered by a one-year warranty. --Cristina Vaamonde
feature_bullets: VICKS STEAM INHALER: Vicks Personal Steam Inhaler, with a soft, comfortable face mask and compatible with soothing menthol Vicks VapoPads, provides a warm mist of steam for temporary relief from allergies, congestion and coughs in a 5-15 minute treatment.

PERSONAL STEAM INHALER: Many find that using a steam inhaler for sinus relief or other breathing problems, such as bronchitis, allergies, and colds, helps them breathe more easily. Vicks inhaler features a face mask, for targeted delivery of pure mist.

COUGH AND CONGESTION RELIEF: When you have a cold, coughing and congestion can make you miserable. Vicks personal steam inhaler provides temporary relief from coughing and congestion, so you get a rest from coughing fits and can breath more freely.

VICKS VAPORIZERS, HUMIDIFIERS, & STEAM INHALERS: Moisture & humidity offer temporary relief from cough & congestion due to colds or allergies. Vicks line of humidifiers & steam inhalers, help you breathe easier wherever you are, from the bedroom to office.
VICKS PERSONAL STEAM INHALER: Our personal steam inhaler helps you breathe easier wherever you are.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
